Chief complaint.description: I feel empty and exhausted all the time, and lately I keep thinking it would be better if I just disappeared.

childhood history.home environment: Raised in Busan in a middle-class household; parents both worked full-time but were generally supportive and nonviolent; occasional conflicts about academic performance but no history of abuse or neglect.
childhood history.members of family: Lived with mother, father, and one younger sister; no other caregivers in the home.
childhood history.social environment: Had a few close friends during childhood and adolescence; described herself as shy but able to maintain stable friendships and participate in small-group activities.

Developmental_Social history.other history: No history of physical, sexual, or emotional abuse reported; no significant legal or financial problems aside from current worries about household expenses.
Developmental_Social history.school history: No special education services; average academic performance; no history of learning disorder or significant behavioral problems; did not actively participate in extracurricular activities due to shyness.
Developmental_Social history.work history: Has worked as an administrative assistant for 12 years at the same trading company; previously evaluated as diligent and reliable; over the past 3 months, has shown decreased concentration and increased mistakes, leading to subtle criticism from her supervisor; maintains polite but somewhat distant relationships with coworkers.

Identifying data.occupation: Administrative assistant at a trading company

Marriage_relationship history.current family structure: Married for 10 years, lives with husband and two children (ages 8 and 5) in an apartment in Seoul; reports increasing emotional distance and frequent arguments with husband about childcare and finances over the last year.

Past medical history.history_1: Hypothyroidism diagnosed 5 years ago, stable on levothyroxine with regular follow-up at a local internal medicine clinic.

symptom_1.alleviating factor: Temporary relief when talking with a close friend or when her husband takes over childcare in the evening
symptom_1.exacerbating factor: Work-related criticism, arguments with husband, and being alone at night
symptom_1.name: Low mood, loss of interest, and fatigue most of the day, nearly every day

symptom_2.alleviating factor: Taking over-the-counter sleep tea and listening to relaxation music
symptom_2.exacerbating factor: Using her smartphone in bed and worrying about work and finances
symptom_2.name: Insomnia with early morning awakening and difficulty falling back asleep

symptom_3.alleviating factor: Supportive reassurance from her sister and brief positive feedback from her manager
symptom_3.exacerbating factor: Perceived mistakes at work and comparing herself with peers on social media
symptom_3.name: Marked feelings of worthlessness and excessive guilt about being a burden to her family

symptom_4.alleviating factor: Being directly supervised by family and coming to the hospital for help
symptom_4.exacerbating factor: Arguments with husband and thoughts about job insecurity
symptom_4.name: Recurrent suicidal thoughts with a past overdose attempt two weeks ago

Present illness.triggering factor: Brought to the emergency department by her husband after she ingested an excessive amount of over-the-counter sleeping pills two weeks ago and recently disclosed persistent suicidal thoughts to her sister.
